With quota 1 still open and no evidence that higher-priority candidates have definitively cleared, optimal strategy is to continue holding and reject Student_C’s apply this round.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your message and for your persistence through the process.

Even in this final round, we are not able to extend an offer to you because higher-priority candidates relative to our priority order remain the basis on which we must allocate the remaining seat, and we cannot commit that seat to your application.

We appreciate the time and effort you have invested, and we wish you the very best with your remaining option(s).

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: School_C’s true priority list ranks Student_C last. Our objective is to match as high as possible on that list within quota 1, and we prefer leaving the seat unfilled rather than accepting someone not in the list (Student_C is in the list but lowest). Throughout the process we have consistently held the seat for higher-priority candidates (Student_D, Student_E, Student_A, Student_B) and communicated that constraint to Student_C. In the final round, we still do not have confirmation that all higher-priority candidates have cleared; given the stated objective and our repeated stance, accepting Student_C would risk foregoing a higher-priority match. Therefore we reject Student_C’s final application.
